description: On March 18, 2020 High-level Coordination Committee for the prevention and control of coronavirus, constituted by the Government of Nepal, decided to take stem action in accordance with prevalent laws if anyone indulges in dissemination of misleading and baseless information regarding COVID-19 through media (including social networks) and creates confusion and panic among the common people. Nepal Police headquarters informed that culprits shall be sent to prison for a year or fined Rs 10,000 or both. Additional punishment will also be given if such fake messages are spread via electronic medium.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Nepal. January 26, 2020. The Government of Nepal is all set to start its Covid-19 vaccination campaign from Wednesday, January 27. As per the Ministry of Health's vaccination roll-out plan, foremost in line to receive the vaccines are frontline workers. After the frontline workers, the next people in line are those above 55 years of age–the death toll among members of this age group is highest. Everyone between 40 to 55 years will be immunized in the third phase and the remaining population will be inoculated in the fourth round.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Nepal. January 27, 2021. The government of Nepal launches its Covid-19 vaccination drive starting with frontline and healthcare workers. The first phase of immunization is taking place as per the Health Ministry’s plans to inoculate the population in a staggered manner based on priority. After the frontline workers, the next people in line are those above 55 years of age–the death toll among members of this age group is highest. Everyone between 40 to 55 years will be immunized in the third phase and the remaining population will be inoculated in the fourth round.
type_sub_cat: Distribution (shipping; storage; administration) of COVID-19 vaccines
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
With the ease of the lockdown on June 15, the government decided on Friday to tighten restrictions again with a night-time curfew in all 77 districts. 

No car or pedestrian allowed at 10pm to 5am 

Those violating the new curfew rules will be punished as per existing laws
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Nepal's trade with China has been halted completely following the closure of the Rasuwagadi border and the Tatopani border — the major trade point between the two nations — due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The government shut Rasuwagadi border on January 28 to prevent the spread of coronavirus after the number of infections in China soared. As a result, Nepal-China trade has been completely halted.

Trade with China will resume only after the coronavirus outbreak is brought under control, but nobody knows when that will happen
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Feb 4 Nepal: In order to check possible outbreak of coronavirus infection, health desks have been set up in 11 different places in Mahottari along the Indian border.

Mahottari District Health Office, people entering through the border checkpoints would be screened to confirm whether the entrants have coronavirus infection.

Health desks have come into operation districts. This is in line with the directive of the Ministry of Health and Population, health desks were set up in the areas in coordination with the concerned district administration office.
type_sub_cat: Health Screenings (e.g. temperature checks)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On Monday March 2, 2020, the Supreme Court issued an interim order to the government asking it to stop flights to and from countries affected by the coronavirus outbreak for a few days or a month, if needed, in order to protect public health. The court ruling came in response to a public interest litigation filed by advocate Purna Rajbansi.

The government issued the travel advisory in order to prevent and control the outbreak and take precautions.

According to the advisory, Nepali nationals are advised to refrain from non-essential travel to countries affected by Covid-19 or in high risk of the virus including China, South Korea, Iran, Japan and Italy.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: March 2, 2020 Nepal. Nationals of the People's Republic of China, the Republic of Korea, Islamic Republic of Iran, Japan and Italy and the people transiting via those countries will have to submit their health certificates stating that they are not infected by COVID- 19, at immigration points in Nepal.
type_sub_cat: Health Certificates
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_what: All Foreign Nationals (Foreign Residents + Foreign Travelers)

description: 02/march 2020 Nepal. The visa-on-arrival facilities extended to the nationals of the People's Republic of China, the Republic of Korea, Islamic Republic of Iran, Japan and Italy, countries highly affected by COVID-19, has been suspended to be effective from 10 March 2020 until further notice. Nationals of the above-mentioned countries may acquire visa from Nepali diplomatic missions abroad after fulfilling required procedures. In this regard, it is requested to follow the notice issues by the Department of Immigration of Nepal on 2 March 2020.
type_sub_cat: Visa restrictions (e.g. suspend issuance of visa)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Nepali government announced on June 29 that it has decided to continue its "eased" lockdown until July 22. A meeting of Council of Ministers held today [June 29] at Baluwatar agreed on giving continuity to the present format of nationwide lockdown, which was revised with restrictions easing to an extent, recently. No further changes will be made in the modality of lockdown, by further loosening restrictions, keeping in mind the growing number of Covid-19 cases in the country. UPDATE: The "eased" lockdown was set to last until July 22, the policy has now ended.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On August 10 the Government of Nepal announced the decision to allow district and sub-district level officials to implement localized lockdowns. Although many restaurants and hotels are now open, some establishments, such as cinemas, salons, and spas are still closed. Trekking and mountaineering are also permitted, according to an earlier announcement.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: It was announced on November 10 that the government of Nepal has formed a committee comprising of secretaries of Finance Ministry, Ministry of Home Affairs, and Ministry of Foreign Affairs to procure Covid-19 vaccines. The committee will conduct adequate research regarding the vaccines being developed by foreign pharmaceutical companies, while also following the required procedures and process to bring the same home.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: Nepal on January 29 closed its two border points with China — Tatopani and Rasuwagadhi — to prevent the spread of the coronavirus.
type_text: This is closure of the tatopani and the Rasuwagadhi border which halted the trade between China and Nepal
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Nepal on Sunday evacuated 175 of its nationals from the Chinese city of Wuhan, the epicenter of a coronavirus outbreak, an official said, after protests by parents of students studying in the city.

A plane operated by state-owned Nepal Airlines carrying 134 men and 41 women, mostly students, landed at Kathmandu’s Tribhuvan International Airport before dawn, Health Minisitry spokesman Mahendra Shrestha said.
type_text: The policy was for evacuation of Nepalese from China.

description:
KATHMANDU (Reuters) - Nepal on Sunday evacuated 175 of its nationals from the Chinese city of Wuhan, the epicenter of a coronavirus outbreak, an official said, after protests by parents of students studying in the city.

A plane operated by state-owned Nepal Airlines carrying 134 men and 41 women, mostly students, landed at Kathmandu’s Tribhuvan International Airport before dawn, Health Minisitry spokesman Mahendra Shrestha said.
type_text: It was evacuation of citizens from Hubei province of China

description:
13 March 2020, Nepal 
All Nepalese nationals residing abroad are requested to avoid non-essential travel are urged to follow high precautionary measured.
type_text: Nepalese living abroad are requested to not travel without essential purpose.
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
KATHMANDU, March 17: A high-level coordination committee to prevent coronavirus outbreak has decided to set up 115 beds for Intensive Care Unit (ICU) and 1,000 isolation wards in the Kathmandu Valley to curb the possible outbreak of the deadly disease that has spread to more than 100 countries across the globe. 

A meeting of the committee led by Deputy Prime Minister and Defense Minister Ishwar Pokhrel on Monday also instructed the provincial governments to set up 120 ICU beds without any further delay.
"Rice, pulses, salt, oil, soap and sugar to be distributed to informal sector workers and destitutes"
type_text: The Nepali govt announced that they will be distributing specified quantities of food and essentials to daily wage workers who lost their jobs and destitutes (those who stay at temples, care homes, monasteries, mosques, churches and old age homes without provisions from their family members and relatives).
enforcer: National Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
April 07,2020 Nepal
Since the outbreak of Covid-19, also dubbed as SARS-Cov-2 in December last year, countries like China and India, on which Nepal relies heavily for protective gear such as face masks, gloves and caps, have prohibited their exports
type_text: Restriction on export of mass and other medical equipment

description:
KATHMANDU, March 9: With coronavirus now spreading beyond China, the government on Monday has decided to temporarily suspend visa-on-arrival for the nationals of three more countries. 

Issuing a press statement on Monday, the Department of Immigration informed that visa-on-arrival has been suspended for the citizens of eight countries including three new European countries- France, Germany and Spain. 

The suspension will be effective from March 10 (Tuesday) to till the date of further notice. UPDATE: The original on arrival visa suspension of 5 nations was extended to 3 more European Countries
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Kathmandu, April 17

As many as 421 inmates, including juveniles, were released from various prisons and juvenile correction facilities across the country in the face of novel coronavirus outbreak.
target_geog_level: One or more other geographical or administrative unit within a country (e.g. county)

description: Nepal opened the Tatopani border on April 8th as a one-way-cross border for to ensure supply of essential goods including medicines and medical equipment from China.
type_text: Nepal initially closed down the tatopani and the resuwaghadi border, which are 2 trading borders between china and nepal, on January 29th. Nepal then reopened the tatopani border, as a one-way-cross for China medical supplies to reach Nepal
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 13, a free Covid-19 helpline was set up for Nepalis looking for any information regarding the Covid-19.

02 March 2020,
Nepali nations directly coming from the countries affected by and in the high risk of COVID-19 and from third countries transiting via those countries will have to undergo mandatory home quarantine for 14 days.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: All countries

description: On April 02, 2020 The Nepali govt along with the Indian govt has set up a temporary quarantine facility at Indo-Nepal border in Nepalgunj for more than 180 Nepalis stuck there.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
March 13,2020 Nepal: 
All foreign nationals entering Nepal since 14th March 2020 are subjected to stay in Self Quarantine and Nepali nationals including NRNs are subjected to stay in Home Quarantine for 14 days from the date of their arrival. 
Foreigners with diplomatic and official visa entering Nepal for the first time or travelling back to Nepal are subjected to stay in Self Quarantine for 14 days.
Foreigners with Business, study and working visa travelling back to Nepal are subjected to stay in Self Quarantine for 14 days.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: All countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The government of Nepal announced on March 20 that it would shut down all nonessential services starting March 22. UPDATE: June 10, 2020. The government of Nepal has decided to ease the lockdown starting June 15, allowing shops to open and vehicles to operate under the odd-even rule. Both private two-wheelers and four-wheelers, including taxis, can operate from Thursday but will have to follow the odd-even rule. Vehicles with an odd license plate will be allowed out on odd dates going by the Nepali calendar while even plates will be allowed on even dates.The high-level committee to prevent and control Covid-19 will prepare protocols for opening shops and operating vehicles on the odd-even number basis, according to a minister
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified businesses
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On June 10th, Nepal announced that offices will run from 8:00 am to 01:00 pm in the first shift and from 1:00 pm to 6:00 pm in the second shift starting June 16th. The government decided to partially relax the lockdown and operate government offices, banks, financial institutions, cooperatives and insurance service in two shifts. The offices operating in two shifts include offices of educational institutions, non-governmental organisations and the private sector. 

Activities and sectors that are barred from operation include teaching-learning activities, international and domestic flights, movement through international border transits, trainings, seminars, assemblies and gatherings, cinema halls, party palaces, entertainment venues as dance bars and pubs, public libraries, museums, zoo, spa, saloons and beauty parlour, swimming pool, shopping mall, group sports and playgrounds, all types of places of worship and social gatherings and passenger-carrying vehicles, where a large number of people gather or have to be together.
type_sub_cat: Bars
institution_status: This type of business  ("Bars") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
